verses.plain: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

tokens.t: Moreover the word of the
came unto me, saying,

verses.plain: Also, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord GOD unto the land of Israel; An end, the end is come upon the four corners of the land.

tokens.t: Also, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord
unto the land of Israel; An end, the end is come upon the four corners of the land.

verses.plain: Now is the end come upon thee, and I will send mine anger upon thee, and will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense upon thee all thine abominations.

tokens.t: Now
the end
upon thee, and I will send mine anger upon thee, and will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense upon thee all thine abominations.

verses.plain: And mine eye shall not spare thee, neither will I have pity: but I will recompense thy ways upon thee, and thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee: and ye shall know that I am the LORD.

tokens.t: And mine eye shall not spare thee, neither will I have pity: but I will recompense thy ways upon thee, and thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee: and ye shall know that I
the

verses.plain: Thus saith the Lord GOD; An evil, an only evil, behold, is come.

tokens.t: Thus saith the Lord
; An evil, an only evil, behold, is come.

verses.plain: An end is come, the end is come: it watcheth for thee; behold, it is come.

tokens.t: An end is come, the end is come: it watcheth for thee; behold, it is come.

verses.plain: The morning is come unto thee, O thou that dwellest in the land: the time is come, the day of trouble is near, and not the sounding again of the mountains.

tokens.t: The morning is come unto thee, O thou that dwellest in the land: the time is come, the day of trouble
near, and not the sounding again of the mountains.

verses.plain: Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee, and accomplish mine anger upon thee: and I will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense thee for all thine abominations.

tokens.t: Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee, and accomplish mine anger upon thee: and I will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense thee for all thine abominations.

verses.plain: And mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will recompense thee according to thy ways and thine abominations that are in the midst of thee; and ye shall know that I am the LORD that smiteth.

tokens.t: And mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will recompense thee according to thy ways and thine abominations
are in the midst of thee; and ye shall know that I
the
that smiteth.

verses.plain: Behold the day, behold, it is come: the morning is gone forth; the rod hath blossomed, pride hath budded.

tokens.t: Behold the day, behold, it is come: the morning is gone forth; the rod hath blossomed, pride hath budded.

verses.plain: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness: none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of any of theirs: neither shall there be wailing for them.

tokens.t: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness: none of them
, nor of their multitude, nor of any of theirs: neither
wailing for them.

verses.plain: The time is come, the day draweth near: let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn: for wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.

tokens.t: The time is come, the day draweth near: let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn: for wrath
upon all the multitude thereof.

verses.plain: For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they were yet alive: for the vision is touching the whole multitude thereof, which shall not return; neither shall any strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.

tokens.t: For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they were yet alive: for the vision
touching the whole multitude thereof,
shall not return; neither shall any strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.

verses.plain: They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none goeth to the battle: for my wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.

tokens.t: They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none goeth to the battle: for my wrath
upon all the multitude thereof.

verses.plain: The sword is without, and the pestilence and the famine within: he that is in the field shall die with the sword; and he that is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.

tokens.t: The sword
without, and the pestilence and the famine within: he that
in the field shall die with the sword; and he that
in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.

verses.plain: ¶ But they that escape of them shall escape, and shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, every one for his iniquity.

tokens.t: ¶ But they that escape of them shall escape, and shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, every one for his iniquity.

verses.plain: All hands shall be feeble, and all knees shall be weak as water.

tokens.t: All hands shall be feeble, and all knees shall be weak
water.

verses.plain: They shall also gird themselves with sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; and shame shall be upon all faces, and baldness upon all their heads.

tokens.t: They shall also gird
with sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; and shame
upon all faces, and baldness upon all their heads.

verses.plain: They shall cast their silver in the streets, and their gold shall be removed: their silver and their gold shall not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the LORD: they shall not satisfy their souls, neither fill their bowels: because it is the stumblingblock of their iniquity.

tokens.t: They shall cast their silver in the streets, and their gold shall be removed: their silver and their gold shall not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the
: they shall not satisfy their souls, neither fill their bowels: because it is the stumblingblock of their iniquity.

verses.plain: ¶ As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty: but they made the images of their abominations and of their detestable things therein: therefore have I set it far from them.

tokens.t: ¶ As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty: but they made the images of their abominations
of their detestable things therein: therefore have I set it far from them.

verses.plain: And I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey, and to the wicked of the earth for a spoil; and they shall pollute it.

tokens.t: And I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey, and to the wicked of the earth for a spoil; and they shall pollute it.

verses.plain: My face will I turn also from them, and they shall pollute my secret place: for the robbers shall enter into it, and defile it.

tokens.t: My face will I turn also from them, and they shall pollute my secret
for the robbers shall enter into it, and defile it.

verses.plain: ¶ Make a chain: for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.

tokens.t: ¶ Make a chain: for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.

verses.plain: Wherefore I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be defiled.

tokens.t: Wherefore I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be defiled.

verses.plain: Destruction cometh; and they shall seek peace, and there shall be none.

tokens.t: Destruction cometh; and they shall seek peace, and
none.

verses.plain: Mischief shall come upon mischief, and rumour shall be upon rumour; then shall they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the ancients.

tokens.t: Mischief shall come upon mischief, and rumour shall be upon rumour; then shall they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the ancients.

verses.plain: The king shall mourn, and the prince shall be clothed with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled: I will do unto them after their way, and according to their deserts will I judge them; and they shall know that I am the LORD.

tokens.t: The king shall mourn, and the prince shall be clothed with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled: I will do unto them after their way, and according to their deserts will I judge them; and they shall know that I
the

footnotes.text: thee according: Heb. upon thee, etc
theirs: or, their tumultuous persons: Heb. tumult
although they…: Heb. though their life were yet among the living
in the…: or, whose life is in his iniquity
be weak…: Heb. go into water
removed: Heb. for a separation, or, uncleanness
it is…: or, their iniquity is their stumblingblock
set it far…: or, made it unto them an unclean thing
their holy…: or, they shall inherit their holy places
